questionTitle: I am very ________ in the information you have given me.
Since his wife died, Roland has gone to ________.
I hope that you have read the contract and understand ________ it means.
When the team scored the winning goal, the crowd's ________ was amazing.
Beryl met her husband ________ a computer dating agency.
As far as I'm ________, it's quite all right for you to leave early.
There was another serious ________ of cholera there last month.
The ________ of the four workers led to a series of industrial troubles.
Betty struggled for a long time before she finally ________ to free herself.
Frank tried to think of a good excuse to ________ going to the meeting.
This meat is rather tough; you have to ________ it for a long time.
I always wear a seat-belt ________ I have an accident.
It usually takes a little while to ________ in a new flat.
Far more people ________ football on a Saturday afternoon than play it.
The bus conductor told him to get off because he couldn't pay the ________.
She is well-qualified ________ typing and very efficient at her work.
In order to ________ museums and legitimate investors and to facilitate the ________ of pilfered artifacts, art magazines often publish photographs of stolen archaeological treasures.
Despite some bad reviews, Horowitz' stature was not ________, and his fans and critics in Tokyo were unanimous in expressing their ________ of his unique talent.
a French window = ________.
anwers: a window that gives out on a brick wall
a window that turns out to be too small
a double glass door that opens on to a garden or balcony

questionTitle: The Tabors' fortune was ________ at more than $100 million.
